MICHALEWICZ.reference: @article{vanaret2020certified,title={Certified global minima for a benchmark of difficult optimization problems},author={Vanaret, Charlie and Gotteland, Jean-Baptiste and Durand, Nicolas and Alliot, Jean-Marc},journal={arXiv preprint arXiv:2003.09867},year={2020}}
MICHALEWICZ.dev_comment: Optima here present are taken from the article in refence. They are all been validated with a threshold of 1e-7 however better solutions are likely to exists at an higher precision (e.g. f([2.202906000253365, 1.5707959996814946])=-1.8013034100904715<-1.8013034100904854=f([2.202906,1.570796]) )
MICHALEWICZ.summary: Non-convex and (highly) multimodal. Contains n! local minimum. Use a parameter m that defines the stepness of the curves.
